purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 蚕)
Pictophonetic: 兓 indicates the sound; 虫 (insect) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
蠶食 [ cán shí ]: to nibble away at (as silkworm consume leaves); fig. to embezzle progressively
蠶豆 [ cán dòu ]: broad bean (Vicia faba); fava bean
蠶繭 [ cán jiǎn ]: silkworm cocoon
蠶絲 [ cán sī ]: natural silk (secreted by silkworm)

heisig_chinese_memo: The waitresses serve tables at night and work at the silkworm insects factory by day.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: There are no insects in heaven - well, that is, except for silkworms. What, do you expect Jesus to import his fancy robes from China?
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "䖵" and "朁", the original meaning is an insect whose larva can spin silk and form cocoons. "Shuowen": "Ren Siye. Congyou, Xiaosheng." "Huainanzi-Lan Mingxun": "Silk silk is perfect for business."

" Silkworm " can mean raising silkworms. "Shu‧Yugong": "Mulberry soil is silkworm." Kong Yingdashu: "The soil is suitable for mulberry, and the mulberry is the silkworm.

" Silkworm " can also be extended to erosion. Tang Sunqiao's "Wu Emperor's Legacy Sword Record" Volume 5: "Gu in the hearts of the people, silkworm in the people's livelihood."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "䖵" and "朁", the original meaning is an insect whose larva can spin silk and form cocoons.
humanum_full_description:
從「䖵」，「朁」聲，本義為幼蟲能吐絲、結繭的昆蟲。《說文》：「任絲也。从䖵，朁聲。」 《淮南子‧覽冥訓》：「蠶咡絲而商絃絕。」

　　「蠶」可表示養蠶。《書‧禹貢》：「桑土既蠶。」孔穎達疏：「宜桑之土，既得桑養蠶矣。」

　　「蠶」還可引申為侵蝕。唐孫樵《武皇遺劍錄》卷五：「蠱於民心，蠶於民生。」
humanum_short_description: 從「䖵」，「朁」聲，本義為幼蟲能吐絲、結繭的昆蟲。

從「 䖵 」，「 朁 」聲，本義為幼蟲能吐絲、結繭的昆蟲。《說文》：「任絲也。从䖵，朁聲。」 《淮南子‧覽冥訓》：「蠶咡絲而商絃絕。」 「 蠶 」可表示養蠶。《書‧禹貢》：「桑土既蠶。」孔穎達疏：「宜桑之土，既得桑養蠶矣。」 「 蠶 」還可引申為侵蝕。唐孫樵《武皇遺劍錄》卷五：「蠱於民心，蠶於民生。」
From the sound of " 䖵" and " 朁", the original meaning is an insect whose larva can spin silk and form cocoons. "Shuowen": "Ren Siye. Congyou, Xiaosheng." "Huainanzi-Lan Mingxun": "Silk silk is perfect for business." " Silkworm" can mean raising silkworms. "Shu‧Yugong": "Mulberry soil is silkworm." Kong Yingdashu: "The soil is suitable for mulberry, and the mulberry is the silkworm. " Silkworm" can also be extended to erosion. Tang Sunqiao's "Wu Emperor's Legacy Sword Record" Volume 5: "Gu in the hearts of the people, silkworm in the people's livelihood."

蠶字的基本解释

蠶
cán
见“蚕”。

蠶字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cán］
［《廣韻》昨含切，平覃，從。］
亦作“蚕1”。“蚕2”的繁体字。亦作“蚕2”。亦作“蝅1”。亦作“蠺1”。
(1)昆虫名。幼虫能吐丝、结茧。有家蚕、柞蚕等。茧丝为重要的纤维资源。
(2)养蚕。
(3)蚕事；养蚕的工作。
(4)侵蚀。
(5)引申为侵害者。
(6)传说蜀地开辟者蚕丛的简称。参见“蠶鳬”。
(7)见“蠶兒”。

蠶字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蠶； 康熙笔画：24； 页码：页1103第33
【唐韻】昨含切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】徂含切，?音?。絲蟲也。【說文】任絲也。【詩·豳風】蠶月條桑。【書·禹貢】桑土旣蠶。【淮南子·天文訓】蠶珥絲而商絃絕。【博物志】蠶三化，先孕而後交，不交者亦產子。【爾雅翼】蠶之狀，喙呥呥類馬，色斑斑似虎。初拂謂之蚝，以毛掃之，蠶尚小，不欲見露氣。桑葉著懷中令暖，然後切之得氣，則衆惡除也。【酉陽雜俎】食而不飮者蠶。　又原蠶。【埤雅】再蠶謂之原蠶，一名魏蠶，今以晚葉養之。　又紅蠶。蠶足於葉三俯三起，二十七日而蠶已老，則紅，故謂之紅蠶。　又野蠶。【後漢·光武紀】野蠶成繭，被于山阜。　又華蠶。【述異記】園客種五色香草，啖華蠶，得繭一百二十枚，大如甕。　又【本草】石蠶，一名沙蝨，乃東澗水中細蟲。　又雪蠶，生隂山及峨嵋山，北人謂之雪蛆。　又金蠶，屈如指環，食故緋帛錦，如蠶之食葉也。　又蠶室。【晉書·禮志】皇后親乗車東郊苑中蠶室祭蠶神。　又蠶神。【爾雅翼】今蠶神曰苑窳婦人、寓氏公主，凡二神。　又人名。【成都記】蠶叢氏，蜀

silkworm
Basic explanation of words
silkworm
cán
See "Silkworm".
silkworm
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cán］
["Guangyun" Hanqie yesterday, Pingtan, Cong. ]
Also known as "Silkworm 1". The traditional characters of "Silkworm 2". Also known as "Silkworm 2". Also known as "蝅1". Also known as "Calabash 1".
(1) The name of the insect. The larvae can spin silk and form cocoons. There are silkworm, tussah and so on. Cocoon silk is an important fiber resource.
(2) Sericulture.
(3) Sericulture; the work of raising silkworms.
(4) Erosion.
(5) Extended to be the offender.
(6) The abbreviation of Can Cong, the founder of the legendary Shu area. See "Silkworm".
(7) See "Caner".
silkworm
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　 Silkworm; Kangxi Strokes: 24; Page Number: Page 1103 Page 33
[Tang Yun] Hanqie yesterday [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Hanqie, "yin?". Filaria also. [Said Wen] Ren Si also. 【Poetry·Binfeng】The silkworm moon mulberry. [Book·Yugong] Mulberry silkworm. [Huainanzi·Tiantian Training] Silkworm and silk are exquisite in business. 【Natural History】Silkworms have three transformations, they become pregnant first and then bred. Those who do not bred also give birth. 【Erya Wing】The shape of a silkworm, the beak is a snarling horse, and the spots resemble tigers. The first brush is called the oyster, and the hair is used to sweep it. The silkworm is still small and does not want to see the air. Mulberry leaves warmth in his arms, and then cuts to get angry, then all evil is eliminated. 【Youyang Miscellaneous Cu】those who eat but not eat silkworms.　The original silkworm. [Piya] The silkworm is called the original silkworm, a Wei silkworm, which is raised by leaves tonight.　Red silkworm again. The silkworm's foot rises three times at Yesan, and the silkworm is red when it is old on the 27th, so it is called the red silkworm.　And wild silkworm. [Later Han·Guangwu Period] The wild silkworm became a cocoon and was taken by Shanfu.　And Chinese silkworm. [Survey on the Difference] The gardener grows five-color vanilla and eats Chinese silkworms, and obtains 120 cocoons, which are as large as an urn.　[Materia Medica] Stone silkworm, a sand louse, is a small worm in Dongjian water.　The snow worms, the Yinshan Mountain and the Emei Mountain, are called snow maggots by the northerners.　Golden silkworm, like a ring, eats silk brocade, like a silkworm eats leaves.　Jamsil again. [Book of Jin·Lizhi] The Queen personally took a car in Dongjiaoyuan to worship the silkworm god in Jamsil.　Ceram God again. [Er Yayi] The silkworm god today is called Yuanyi woman, Yushi princess, and Fan two gods.　Another name. [Chengdu Story] Can Cong's Family, Shu
